basics.name: Marcos Buccat Jr.
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii At Manoa. I expect to graduate at Fall 2023.

work.summary: General Office Duty. I was given tasks to run errands, make copies, scan, answer calls, and sorting mails.
highlights: Printing, Typing, Answering Phone Calls, Scannng

volunteer.summary: This ethnic community project gave me insights as to what the orginization was fighting for and their determination in doing so. It gave me the opportunity to learn about fighting for social injustices.
highlights: Meeting with other people's to hear their idea to fight for better working conditions, pay, and social justice.
Participate in events to fight for better worker rights.
Practicing the rights to peaceful protest rally

volunteer.summary: I participated in a competition for designing a parking lot. We designed our parking lot on a given schematic of the unkown parking lot and were placed second for this competition.
This was for my Community service project. This was also my first time volunteerring.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Offered to students based on financial need and availability. This fund is prorated according to enrollment. Minimum enrollment is half time. Graduate students enrolled in a 1 credit full-time course will not be considered for this grant.

awards.title: Manoa Opportunity Grant
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.
